With offices in Raleigh and Charlotte, NC, Plexus Capital, LLC (“Plexus”) is a private investment group with $955 million under management that provides growth capital to private, middle market companies through investments in subordinated debt and equity securities. Plexus is actively investing out of its $400 million fourth fund (Plexus Fund IV) which had its final closing in August 2016. Plexus reviews over 1,200 unique transactions annually and typically completes 10–15 new platform investments per year. 
 
Plexus is seeking an analytically-minded individual with data analytics and finance experience to join its Portfolio team, working primarily to support the growing data and technology needs of Plexus. The Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for the development and maintenance of Plexus’ databases and reporting systems as well as its technology systems and initiatives. Additionally, this person will oversee the entire data environment of Plexus and work across disciplines including with the Portfolio, Execution, Business Development, and Investment Operations teams. Specific responsibilities of the Business Intelligence Analyst position will include: 
 
  
The ideal candidate will have an excellent academic track record, database management and analytic experience, and will possess the following characteristics:

full_desc:
ChateauxGreater New York City Area 
Business Intelligence Analyst  
  
  
*Must have Fundraising experience*  
  
   
Position Summary   
  
This position is part of the Information Technology (IT) team which provides information technology solutions that enable direct data-driven decision making by the Development Organization. You will be responsible for management and development of business intelligence and analytics solutions, including internal workflows for the Development Organization. This is a new position reports directly to the Senior Director of Enterprise Applications and Administrative Support.  
   
Responsibilities   
   
·         Partner with Alumni Affairs and Development:  
o    Create and manage financial, statistical, forecast and ad-hoc reports and data models on a regular basis  
o    Deliver timely and targeted information, robust tools and insights to help the department become a more data-driven organization  
o    Rapid analysis of Development Organization data challenges to help build solutions that can be leveraged across the Development team  
o    Use advanced statistical concepts to determine significant sources of process or business function variability; determine recommendations for efficiencies  
o    Coordinate between departments and develop cross-departmental reports  
   
·         Designing and implementing data integration from multiple systems resulting in advanced analytic capabilities:  
o    Writing relational and multidimensional database SQL queries  
o    Developing automated tools and dashboards using Business Objects, Tableau or other development tools to provide actionable information to decision makers.  
o    Develop data marts to enable user empowerment via tools such as Business Objects, Crystal Reports or Tableau.  
o    Provide institutional data research and analytics  
   
·         Investigate and troubleshoot data workflow issues for departments on our enterprise systems (Colleague/Slate/Advance)  
·         Provide end-user support for CRM and reporting software  
o    Develop, manage and maintain workflows in CRM platforms  
·         Create best practice documentation and procedures  
·         Provide technical support during upcoming migrations  
·         Projects as assigned  
   
Qualifications  
   
·         5-8 years of experience in business analytics, consulting, data science, business intelligence, data quality and/or data engineering  
·         Fundraising experience  
·         This role requires someone who can shift focus quickly and keep projects within scope. The successful candidate will be comfortable working in a dynamic, data-driven environment and demonstrate a natural curiosity when digging into the numbers.  
·         Ability to work with all levels of the organization up-to and including Executive Leaders.  
·         Degree in business, statistics, database management or related field preferred  
·         Crystal reports, Tableau, Advanced Power BI, Microsoft SQL Reporting Services (SSRS) and data warehousing skills preferred  
·         Advanced Excel and Querying skills; substantial experience with data analysis and modeling, process improvement  
·         Ability to identify trends and clearly distill and present complex data to colleagues who may not have a technical background  
·         Strong analytical and technical expertise in developing business intelligence solutions/tools/reports.  
·         Excellent conceptual, analytical and quantitative skills.  
·         Ability to translate business needs into reporting solutions.  
·         Sense of urgency to drive impact.  
·         Ability to quickly establish subject matter expertise in a variety of business applications.  
·         Excellent verbal, analytical and problem-solving skills  
·         Critical, creative thinker, with the ability to provide data-driven insights and recommendations and see ideas through to completion  
·         Excellent communication skills both orally and verbally.  
·         Unflappable and steady personality who can stay calm under pressure.  
·         Personable and easily builds business relationships/partnerships.  
·         Excellent organizational and prioritization skills  
·         Ability to set goals, establish timelines, and ensure that key milestones and deliverables are met  
·         Ability to quickly relate data to processes within disparate departments such as Alumni Affairs, Fund Raising, Finance and Admissions    
·         Prior experience with fundraising databases and in particular CRM: Advance or Blackbaud CRM, a plus
industries: Information Technology and Services, Higher Education, Fund-Raising

Business Intelligence Analyst  
Grand Rapids, Michigan  
Full-Time Position  
   
Do you have a passion for working in healthcare and looking for a new challenge? Then this is the perfect position for you! As a Business Intelligence Analyst you will be responsible for designing, building, and supporting business intelligence and analytical initiatives to enhance departmental and organizational effectiveness, efficiency, and safety with a primary focus on Quality Metrics and Inpatient reporting.  
  
If you feel that this describes you keep reading and apply!  
  
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:  
·         3+ years’ experience working with Microsoft SQL Server  
o    SQL functions Includes: Building out databases, report writing, writing complex queries, analyzing large queries, etc.  
·         Strong Analysis skills including 3+ years’ experience as an Analyst  
o    Past positions may include Business Analyst, Data Analyst, BI Analyst, etc.  
·         Experience working in a reporting environment, and working with SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services)  
o     Includes SSIS package development and support.  
·         Other tools such as Crystal Reports, Tableau, Power BI and others are bonus, but willing to teach individuals.  
·         Must have experience working with internal technical teams and customers or other third-party vendors.  
·         Preferred: Experience working in a healthcare environment, specifically with EPIC.  
   
RESPONSIBILITIES:  
   
·         Work heavily with SQL database. SQL functions Includes: Building out databases, report writing, writing complex queries, analyzing large queries, etc.  
·         Designs database objects, queries and solutions to support business needs.  
·          Implements and maintains data marts, data warehouses and ETL processes.  
·         Creates test scripts to identify and address data inconsistencies. Performs quality audits of processes in order to verify data integrity.  
·         Interface with internal technical and business teams, as well as customer.  
   
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU…?

Business Intelligence Analyst 2  
 The business intelligence analyst (II) is expected to develop and implement dashboards, reporting systems, and conduct ad hoc analysis as needed for the design and business teams.  Will assist with the design and development of dashboards and reporting, construct data queries, and produce Power BI visualizations that enable our team to quickly understand our live business.  The Business Intelligence Analyst is expected to work rapidly and iteratively on service deployments and dashboards, and adjust accordingly to the needs of a live game service.  Education: • STEM, data science, or business intelligence degrees or certifications preferred, but not required  Top 3 Skills • Solid proficiency in Transact SQL or Kusto querying; the successful candidate must be able to build queries and provide analysis in a rapid fashion • Strong proficiency in data visualization and reporting; environment tech stack in Azure Kusto Explorer / Power BI are nice to have, but not necessary if they show aptitude from similar experience or similar platforms such as Tableau, AWS tech stack (Kinesis, Athena, S3, Redshift, Glue, Aurora, etc.) • Familiarity with data analysis (statistical, data science, and quantitative methods)  Nice to have: Prior experience in the interactive industry space, free-to-play game development, games-as-a-service, or mobile game development

full_desc:
3SI - Third Sector IntelligenceSeattle, Washington 
 
Job Description: Business Intelligence Engineer 
3SI is a small Seattle area consulting firm. Visa renewal or future sponsorship is not provided. Qualification for selection includes being a US resident or Green Card holder prior to starting work. 
 
Why work for 3Si? 
3Si is a mission-driven consulting firm headquartered in Seattle, WA. We help our clients—primarily non-governmental organizations, philanthropies, and government—use data and information to make better decisions and create positive change. We serve the child welfare, education, community building, environment, health, transportation, and workforce development sectors. We provide: 
·       Data systems and organizational solutions 
·       Research and analytics 
·       Facilitation and stakeholder engagement 
·       Planning and program evaluation 
We seek a Business Intelligence Engineer who is mission driven and has exceptional technical, analytical, and quantitative problem-solving skills and demonstrated leadership abilities in a team environment. A Business Intelligence Engineer will successfully assess business needs and determine technical solutions to business problems. Qualified candidates have an excellent record of professional achievement, know how to adapt their knowledge, approach, and experience to a range of situations and circumstances, and want to make a positive impact. They work to exceed expectations, and they have a fervent desire to keep learning and growing. 
 
Diversity & Inclusion. 3Si is committed to building diverse teams where people of all identities and backgrounds are welcome, included, and respected. Social equity is a key premise of 3Si’s work and we aspire to reflect that value in the composition of our team. We strongly encourage women, gender diverse candidates, and candidates who identify as a minority to apply for this position. 
Salary range is $120k - $135k and is commensurate with expertise and experience. A comprehensive benefits package is included. 
 
Please send resume and cover letter to careers@team3Si.com. 
 
As a Business Intelligence Engineer, responsibilities will include:

This is a 4 month contract for a Business Intelligence Engineer role in Seattle.  Looking for a SQL and Front End focused BIE, looking for speed with queries and 1 coding language, some PM work a plus.  Collect requirements, build out front end reporting.  
 
Day to Day: • Querying data bases (SQL) • Working with client group to gather business requirements and developing projects and building out front end reporting for their clients  Team:  
• Sitting with team – daily interaction  • Will need to work independently   Perks of role: • Using leading AWS technologies • Beta testing opportunities  Best experience: • SQL and possibly 1 other coding experience • Worked on a project end to end (driven impact from their project) • Front end BI tool experience   Performance indicators: • Interactions with client groups / customers • SQL efficiency / query in least amount of time possible • Able to work autonomously (once ramped up)  Top 3: a.) SQL b.) Project Management c.) Front end BI tool experience (2+)  
Please apply online or email andy.dalmau@scom-usa.com. If you don t meet these requirements, but are interested in other s.com opportunities, please register with us online at ess.impellam.com.  
Employer will not sponsor applicants for work visas for this position.

full_desc:
PayScale, Inc.Seattle, Washington 
 
The Role:  
  
Do you have that curious analytical mind with the sniffer for finding additional revenue & operational efficiencies? If so, we have the perfect role for you.  
  
We are seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst who will join our Sales Operations team to provide Strategic Insights in support of a wide-range of Sales operational functions, including; forecasting, strategy & planning, compensation design & support, sales technology investments, process improvements, and PayScale’s go-to-market strategy. You bring strong Technical acumen with data and an intuition for business to help inform & influence our Sales team’s continued growth and evolution.  
  
You are an expert in sales automation, process and productivity. You're analytical with the ability to make data sing for purpose and truly see around corners. You are experienced in ground breaking change during critical junctions of company growth -- Think process innovation meets clean-through-the-clutter. You will be responsible for bringing order to the organics without making it feel too rules based. You have an excellent understanding of sales incentives plans and sales enablement techniques. You currently lead operations for a large inside sales team with thousands of marketing qualified leads coming in every month.  
We are growing quickly, with eyes on further expansion into new markets and new sales channels. There couldn't be a better time for you to come join our Sales Ops team and make a noticeable impact!  
  
In this role, you will support a blend of Sales Business Intelligence and Sales Strategy & Planning needs:  
  
Sales Business Intelligence - Data, Insights, Analytics, and Forecasting  
  
Strategy, Planning & Special Projects

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: HELP US MAKE HISTORY. Millions trust Leafly to help them find unbiased information about nearby strains and dispensaries, discover new canna
full_desc:
Leafly71 Columbia Street, Seattle, WA 98104, US 
HELP US MAKE HISTORY. Millions trust Leafly to help them find unbiased information about nearby strains and dispensaries, discover new cannabis brands and products, and to stay up-to-date on the latest cannabis information. Leafly started as an excel spreadsheet and has since grown to become the largest cannabis information resource in the world. We are expanding rapidly, and we are looking for smart, forward-thinking leaders to help us achieve our goal of shaping the global cannabis landscape.    
   
A career at Leafly combines the excitement of a start-up, the social purpose of a non-profit, and the growth opportunities of a major corporation. Leafly salaries and benefit packages are very competitive, the office perks are excellent, and we promise that you will never be bored. If you have what it takes, you will be joining a global network of innovative, passionate individuals on a revolutionary mission to change the world for the better.  
   
We are currently searching for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join the Leafly team. The Business Intelligence Analyst partners with internal business units to address strategic and operational questions facing the business. We are looking for someone who enjoys the technical aspects of coding, data analysis, solving complex problems, and data advocacy to solve exciting business problems, as well as interacting with our staff and senior leaders to drive business results. In this position you will design queries to extract data from large database systems, and analyze this data to assist cross-functional business teams in deciphering our complex marketplace to help our customers succeed.  
   
What We Are Looking For  
  
  
Key Responsibilities  
  
  
Requirements  
  
  
The job description is representative of typical duties and responsibilities for the position and is not all-inclusive. Other duties and responsibilities may be assigned in accordance with business needs. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. A background check will be conducted after a conditional offer of employment is extended.

The Business Intelligence (BI) developer will provide business intelligence and commerce support for Nucor Tubular Products (NTP). The successful candidates will support NTP initiatives by designing, building and supporting Product Group and Division Business Intelligence applications. The Business Intelligence Architect will be responsible for (1) defining BI requirements that provide insights to business results (2) Build metadata to support BI visualizations (3) Coordinate and align requirements, metrics and data definitions across product group (4) Build and/or facilitate the creation of BI visualizations (5) Support product group and division efforts in building local BI capabilities (6) Training and training resource development for BI consumers, and other duties as assigned. This position can be located at either the Chicago, Louisville, or Birmingham office within NTP. Safety is the most important part of all jobs within Nucor; therefore, candidates must be able to demonstrate the ability to initiate, lead, and uphold safety policies, practices, procedures, and housekeeping standards at all times.

24 Seven is growing! We’re the leading creative staffing and recruiting firm working with today’s most sought after employers and we’re looking for dedicated professionals, like you, to join our team. We are the go-to talent source supporting the world’s top teams in Digital Marketing, Creative Services, Technology, eCommerce, Fashion, and Beauty.  
   
24 Seven is seeking an ambitious and laser-focused Business Development Manager to be an integral part of our rockstar Portland  team.  With a fun and inspiring company culture, bright and stylish offices, a generous compensation package, and perks and incentives including excellent health benefits, generous vacation package and career development opportunities, 24 Seven is the perfect place to let your entrepreneurial spirit flourish in a Business Development role.  
   
Here’s a snapshot of what you’ll do as a Business Development Manager:

                    o   401(k) with company match  
    
                    o   Generous paid time off policy (starting at 26 days per year!)  
   
                    o   Ongoing training & career development opportunities  
   
                    o    Perks including, in-office birthday celebrations, discounts at local gyms and yoga studios, unlimited snacks, catered meals for special occasions, happy hours, and volunteer opportunities  
                    o   Ease daily transportation stresses and enjoy convenient, free parking at the office’s lot                          o   Imagine a warm, sunshine-filled tropical destination as high producers are eligible to attend the company retreat!

full_desc:
The Gunter GroupPortland, Oregon Area 
At The Gunter Group, we set out to build a different firm where we leverage strong relationships to achieve great things in partnership with our clients. Our driven employees make us who we are – a talented team of leaders with deep and diverse professional experience. The big firm model does not resonate with us. We believe there is a better way to continually deliver high value service. We live where we work, so when we help our clients’ communities, we are helping to grow our own.  
  
By utilizing a listen-first philosophy and being present, we are able to partner with our clients to provide exceptional service and solutions. We take pride in living out our non-negotiable qualities on a daily basis and are seeking motivated candidates who exemplify these attributes and will contribute to our culture. Oregon Business magazine has named The Gunter Group one of the 100 Best Companies to Work For in Oregon five years in a row. Additionally, we have been recognized in the community for our continued commitment to hiring veterans.  
  
We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst and designer of business intelligence solutions who likes to solve meaty problems. Candidates should be motivated with a collaborative approach and proven success designing business intelligence products and analytical solutions. The ideal candidate will be a SQL and Tableau expert and possess the technical skills to manage, manipulate, and organize data in a meaningful way for business users and organizational leaders. If you are a fit with our firm, please submit a resume along with a cover letter to let us know why.  
  
Expectations for Business Intelligence Analyst candidates:  
  
Preferred/Required Skills and Experience:  
  
We would love to talk to you if:

full_desc:
DSD LabsPearl Harbor, Hawaii 
DSD Laboratories, Inc. is looking for talented individuals that have recent experience in IT and software development/configuration to work on cutting edge technologies and capabilities that bring data/information together to support leadership decision making, wartime planning and business/mission execution, commonly known as a logistics common operating picture. Your skills and expertise will help us identify user requirements, collaborate with developers, acquire and integrate the required data/information, and deliver a variety of visualization capabilities to the users and stakeholders. 
 
Candidate will support HQ Pacific Air Forces (PACAF) Air Force Forces (AFFOR) Logistics Common Operating Picture (LOGCOP), an information management and visualization capability.  
 
Candidate will: 
- Capture and manage user and mission requirements 
- Conduct user interviews at all organizational levels to identify, analyze, and document user requirements.  
- Perform engineering design evaluations and create requirements traceability matrices to ensure that design fully supports functional requirements.  
- Make design and solution recommendations – identifying options and creating prototypes to exploit enterprise services, leveraging business intelligence tools like Tableau, SAP Business Objects, and IBM Cognos.  
- Collaborate with program management and development team to ensure requirements are met, to maximize reuse of existing capabilities and data 
- Lead or participate in system development lifecycle milestone reviews (requirements, design, test, and deployment). 
- Collaborate with the appropriate resources to identify authoritative data sources to support requirements and propose technical solutions and options to make information available to support operational needs.  
- Modify / create repeatable processes and reusable templates to manage the lifecycle of the LOGCOP (requirements specification, traceability matrix, wireframes, prototypes, etc.). 
- Develop training materials for various levels of the organization 
- Collaborate with users to troubleshoot functionality issues.  
- Update senior leadership and make recommendations for strategic planning and prioritization of requirements, technologies, and data acquisition to meet customer goals.  
 
Experience:  
 
Estimated travel is less than 5%.
